cause.description:
There are three different types of Niemann- Pick Disease, types A, B, and C. With the diagnosis of types A, and B there is a deficiency of a specific enzyme reported with the patients. Patients with type A experience a severe neurological disorder that leads to death by the age of 2- 4 years. There are no treatment options for babies with type A disease. Patients with type B often experience enlarged livers and spleens. They may have respiratory problems, which strain the heart leading to heart disease later in life. Patients with type B often are able to live through until their teens or early adulthood. If type B is diagnosed early, sometimes a bone marrow transplant with help the patient. Patients with Type C of Niemann- Pick Disease are often labelled with learning disorders and mild retardation. There is often a delay in fine motor skills. Many of the symptoms of type C can be controlled with medication.

cause.mission: find treatments and a cure for all types of Niemann-Pick Disease.
